section: rlgl.h C:/Users/HP/Documents/GitHub/Minero-Game/Old/Classes/lib/rlgl.h Go to the documentation of this file.1 /********************************************************************************************** 2 * 3 * rlgl v4.5 - A multi-OpenGL abstraction layer with an immediate-mode style API 4 * 5 * An abstraction layer for multiple OpenGL versions (1.1, 2.1, 3.3 Core, 4.3 Core, ES 2.0) 6 * that provides a pseudo-OpenGL 1.1 immediate-mode style API (rlVertex, rlTranslate, rlRotate...) 7 * 8 * When choosing an OpenGL backend different than OpenGL 1.1, some internal buffer are 9 * initialized on rlglInit() to accumulate vertex data. 10 * 11 * When an internal state change is required all the stored vertex data is renderer in batch, 12 * additionally, rlDrawRenderBatchActive() could be called to force flushing of the batch. 13 * 14 * Some additional resources are also loaded for convenience, here the complete list: 15 * - Default batch (RLGL.defaultBatch): RenderBatch system to accumulate vertex data 16 * - Default texture (RLGL.defaultTextureId): 1x1 white pixel R8G8B8A8 17 * - Default shader (RLGL.State.defaultShaderId, RLGL.State.defaultShaderLocs) 18 * 19 * Internal buffer (and additional resources) must be manually unloaded calling rlglClose(). 20 * 21 * 22 * CONFIGURATION: 23 * 24 * #define GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_11 25 * #define GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_21 26 * #define GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33 27 * #define GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_43 28 * #define GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2 29 * Use selected OpenGL graphics backend, should be supported by platform 30 * Those preprocessor defines are only used on rlgl module, if OpenGL version is 31 * required by any other module, use rlGetVersion() to check it 32 * 33 * #define RLGL_IMPLEMENTATION 34 * Generates the implementation of the library into the included file. 35 * If not defined, the library is in header only mode and can be included in other headers 36 * or source files without problems. But only ONE file should hold the implementation. 37 * 38 * #define RLGL_RENDER_TEXTURES_HINT 39 * Enable framebuffer objects (fbo) support (enabled by default) 40 * Some GPUs could not support them despite the OpenGL version 41 * 42 * #define RLGL_SHOW_GL_DETAILS_INFO 43 * Show OpenGL extensions and capabilities detailed logs on init 44 * 45 * #define RLGL_ENABLE_OPENGL_DEBUG_CONTEXT 46 * Enable debug context (only available on OpenGL 4.3) 47 * 48 * rlgl capabilities could be customized just defining some internal 49 * values before library inclusion (default values listed): 50 * 51 * #define RL_DEFAULT_BATCH_BUFFER_ELEMENTS 8192 // Default internal render batch elements limits 52 * #define RL_DEFAULT_BATCH_BUFFERS 1 // Default number of batch buffers (multi-buffering) 53 * #define RL_DEFAULT_BATCH_DRAWCALLS 256 // Default number of batch draw calls (by state changes: mode, texture) 54 * #define RL_DEFAULT_BATCH_MAX_TEXTURE_UNITS 4 // Maximum number of textures units that can be activated on batch drawing (SetShaderValueTexture()) 55 * 56 * #define RL_MAX_MATRIX_STACK_SIZE 32 // Maximum size of internal Matrix stack 57 * #define RL_MAX_SHADER_LOCATIONS 32 // Maximum number of shader locations supported 58 * #define RL_CULL_DISTANCE_NEAR 0.01 // Default projection matrix near cull distance 59 * #define RL_CULL_DISTANCE_FAR 1000.0 // Default projection matrix far cull distance 60 * 61 * When loading a shader, the following vertex attribute and uniform 62 * location names are tried to be set automatically: 63 * 64 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_ATTRIB_NAME_POSITION "vertexPosition" // Bound by default to shader location: 0 65 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_ATTRIB_NAME_TEXCOORD "vertexTexCoord" // Bound by default to shader location: 1 66 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_ATTRIB_NAME_NORMAL "vertexNormal" // Bound by default to shader location: 2 67 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_ATTRIB_NAME_COLOR "vertexColor" // Bound by default to shader location: 3 68 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_ATTRIB_NAME_TANGENT "vertexTangent" // Bound by default to shader location: 4 69 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_MVP "mvp" // model-view-projection matrix 70 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_VIEW "matView" // view matrix 71 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_PROJECTION "matProjection" // projection matrix 72 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_MODEL "matModel" // model matrix 73 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_NORMAL "matNormal" // normal matrix (transpose(inverse(matModelView)) 74 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_UNIFORM_NAME_COLOR "colDiffuse" // color diffuse (base tint color, multiplied by texture color) 75 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_SAMPLER2D_NAME_TEXTURE0 "texture0" // texture0 (texture slot active 0) 76 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_SAMPLER2D_NAME_TEXTURE1 "texture1" // texture1 (texture slot active 1) 77 * #define RL_DEFAULT_SHADER_SAMPLER2D_NAME_TEXTURE2 "texture2" // texture2 (texture slot active 2) 78 * 79 * DEPENDENCIES: 80 * 81 * - OpenGL libraries (depending on platform and OpenGL version selected) 82 * - GLAD OpenGL extensions loading library (only for OpenGL 3.3 2017 case GL_DEBUG_TYPE_PUSH_GROUP: msgType = "PUSH_GROUP"; break; 2018 case GL_DEBUG_TYPE_POP_GROUP: msgType = "POP_GROUP"; break; 2019 case GL_DEBUG_TYPE_OTHER: msgType = "OTHER"; break; 2020 default: break; 3248 } 3249 3250 // Generate mipmap data for selected texture 3251 // NOTE: Only supports GPU mipmap generation 3252 void rlGenTextureMipmaps(unsigned int id, int width, int height, int format, int *mipmaps) 3253 { 3254 #if defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2) 3255 glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, id); 3256 3257 // Check if texture is power-of-two (POT) 3258 bool texIsPOT = false; 3259 3260 if (((width > 0) && ((width & (width - 1)) == 0)) && 3261 ((height > 0) && ((height & (height - 1)) == 0))) texIsPOT = true; 3262 3263 if ((texIsPOT) || (RLGL.ExtSupported.texNPOT)) 3264 { 3265 //glHint(GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT, GL_DONT_CARE); // Hint for mipmaps generation algorithm: GL_FASTEST, GL_NICEST, GL_DONT_CARE 3266 glGenerateMipmap(GL_TEXTURE_2D); // Generate mipmaps automatically 3267 3268 #define MIN(a,b) (((a)<(b))? (a):(b)) 3269 #define MAX(a,b) (((a)>(b))? (a):(b)) 3270 3271 *mipmaps = 1 + (int)floor(log(MAX(width, height))/log(2)); 3272 TRACELOG(RL_LOG_INFO, "TEXTURE: [ID %i] Mipmaps generated automatically, total: %i", id, *mipmaps); 3273 } 3274 else TRACELOG(RL_LOG_WARNING, "TEXTURE: [ID %i] Failed to generate mipmaps", id); 3275 3276 glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0); 3277 #else 3278 TRACELOG(RL_LOG_WARNING, "TEXTURE: [ID %i] GPU mipmap generation not supported", id); 3279 #endif 3280 } 3281 3282 3283 // Read texture pixel data 3284 void *rlReadTexturePixels(unsigned int id, int width, int height, int format) 3285 { 3286 void *pixels = NULL; 3287 3288 #if defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_11) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) 3289 glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, id); 3290 3291 // NOTE: Using texture id, we can retrieve some texture info (but not on OpenGL ES 2.0) 3292 // Possible texture info: GL_TEXTURE_RED_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_GREEN_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_BLUE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_ALPHA_SIZE 3293 //int width, height, format; 3294 //glGetTexLevelParameteriv(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_TEXTURE_WIDTH, &width); 3295 //glGetTexLevelParameteriv(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_TEXTURE_HEIGHT, &height); 3296 //glGetTexLevelParameteriv(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_TEXTURE_INTERNAL_FORMAT, &format); 3297 3298 // NOTE: Each row written to or read from by OpenGL pixel operations like glGetTexImage are aligned to a 4 byte boundary by default, which may add some padding. 3299 // Use glPixelStorei to modify padding with the GL_[UN]PACK_ALIGNMENT setting. 3300 // GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT affects operations that read from OpenGL memory (glReadPixels, glGetTexImage, etc.) 3301 // GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT affects operations that write to OpenGL memory (glTexImage, etc.) 3302 glPixelStorei(GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT, 1); 3303 3304 unsigned int glInternalFormat, glFormat, glType; 3305 rlGetGlTextureFormats(format, &glInternalFormat, &glFormat, &glType); 3306 unsigned int size = rlGetPixelDataSize(width, height, format); 3307 3308 if ((glInternalFormat != -1) && (format < RL_PIXELFORMAT_COMPRESSED_DXT1_RGB)) 3309 { 3310 pixels = RL_MALLOC(size); 3311 glGetTexImage(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, glFormat, glType, pixels); 3312 } 3313 else TRACELOG(RL_LOG_WARNING, "TEXTURE: [ID %i] Data retrieval not suported for pixel format (%i)", id, format); 3314 3315 glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0); 3316 #endif 3317 3318 #if defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2) 3319 // glGetTexImage() is not available on OpenGL ES 2.0 3320 // Texture width and height are required on OpenGL ES 2.0. There is no way to get it from texture id. 3321 // Two possible Options: 3322 // 1 - Bind texture to color fbo attachment and glReadPixels() 3323 // 2 - Create an fbo, activate it, render quad with texture, glReadPixels() 3324 // We are using Option 1, just need to care for texture format on retrieval 3325 // NOTE: This behaviour could be conditioned by graphic driver... 3326 unsigned int fboId = rlLoadFramebuffer(width, height); 3327 3328 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, fboId); 3329 glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0); 3330 3331 // Attach our texture to FBO 3332 glFramebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0, GL_TEXTURE_2D, id, 0); 3333 3334 // We read data as RGBA because FBO texture is configured as RGBA, despite binding another texture format 3335 pixels = (unsigned char *)RL_MALLOC(rlGetPixelDataSize(width, height, RL_PIXELFORMAT_UNCOMPRESSED_R8G8B8A8)); 3336 glReadPixels(0, 0, width, height, GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, pixels); 3337 3338 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, 0); 3339 3340 // Clean up temporal fbo 3341 rlUnloadFramebuffer(fboId); 3342 #endif 3343 3344 return pixels; 3345 } 3346 3347 // Read screen pixel data (color buffer) 3348 unsigned char *rlReadScreenPixels(int width, int height) 3349 { 3350 unsigned char *screenData = (unsigned char *)RL_CALLOC(width*height*4, sizeof(unsigned char)); 3351 3352 // NOTE 1: glReadPixels returns image flipped vertically -> (0,0) is the bottom left corner of the framebuffer 3353 // NOTE 2: We are getting alpha channel! Be careful, it can be transparent if not cleared properly! 3354 glReadPixels(0, 0, width, height, GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, screenData); 3355 3356 // Flip image vertically! 3357 unsigned char *imgData = (unsigned char *)RL_MALLOC(width*height*4*sizeof(unsigned char)); 3358 3359 for (int y = height - 1; y >= 0; y--) 3360 { 3361 for (int x = 0; x < (width*4); x++) 3362 { 3363 imgData[((height - 1) - y)*width*4 + x] = screenData[(y*width*4) + x]; // Flip line 3364 3365 // Set alpha component value to 255 (no trasparent image retrieval) 3366 // NOTE: Alpha value has already been applied to RGB in framebuffer, we don't need it! 3367 if (((x + 1)%4) == 0) imgData[((height - 1) - y)*width*4 + x] = 255; 3368 } 3369 } 3370 3371 RL_FREE(screenData); 3372 3373 return imgData; // NOTE: image data should be freed 3374 } 3375 3376 // Framebuffer management (fbo) 3377 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3378 // Load a framebuffer to be used for rendering 3379 // NOTE: No textures attached 3380 unsigned int rlLoadFramebuffer(int width, int height) 3381 { 3382 unsigned int fboId = 0; 3383 3384 #if (defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2)) && defined(RLGL_RENDER_TEXTURES_HINT) 3385 glGenFramebuffers(1, &fboId); // Create the framebuffer object 3386 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, 0); // Unbind any framebuffer 3387 #endif 3388 3389 return fboId; 3390 } 3391 3392 // Attach color buffer texture to an fbo (unloads previous attachment) 3393 // NOTE: Attach type: 0-Color, 1-Depth renderbuffer, 2-Depth texture 3394 void rlFramebufferAttach(unsigned int fboId, unsigned int texId, int attachType, int texType, int mipLevel) 3395 { 3396 #if (defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2)) && defined(RLGL_RENDER_TEXTURES_HINT) 3397 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, fboId); 3398 3399 switch (attachType) 3400 { 3401 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL0: 3402 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL1: 3403 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL2: 3404 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL3: 3405 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL4: 3406 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL5: 3407 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL6: 3408 case RL_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_CHANNEL7: 3409 { 3410 if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE2D) glFramebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + attachType, GL_TEXTURE_2D, texId, mipLevel); 3411 else if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_RENDERBUFFER) glFramebufferRenderbuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + attachType, GL_RENDERBUFFER, texId); 3412 else if (texType >= RL_ATTACHMENT_CUBEMAP_POSITIVE_X) glFramebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + attachType, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X + texType, texId, mipLevel); 3413 3414 } break; 3415 case RL_ATTACHMENT_DEPTH: 3416 { 3417 if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE2D) glFramebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT, GL_TEXTURE_2D, texId, mipLevel); 3418 else if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_RENDERBUFFER) glFramebufferRenderbuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT, GL_RENDERBUFFER, texId); 3419 3420 } break; 3421 case RL_ATTACHMENT_STENCIL: 3422 { 3423 if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE2D) glFramebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT, GL_TEXTURE_2D, texId, mipLevel); 3424 else if (texType == RL_ATTACHMENT_RENDERBUFFER) glFramebufferRenderbuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT, GL_RENDERBUFFER, texId); 3438 3439 #if (defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2)) && defined(RLGL_RENDER_TEXTURES_HINT) 3440 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, id); 3441 3442 GLenum status = glCheckFramebufferStatus(GL_FRAMEBUFFER); break; 3452 #endif 3453 case GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MISSING_ATTACHMENT: TRACELOG(RL_LOG_WARNING, "FBO: [ID %i] Framebuffer has a missing attachment", id); break; 3454 default: break; 3455 } 3456 } 3457 3458 glBindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, 0); 3459 3460 result = (status == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE); 3461 #endif 3462 3463 return result; 3464 } 3465 3466 // Unload framebuffer from GPU memory 3467 // NOTE: All attached textures/cubemaps/renderbuffers are also deleted 3468 void rlUnloadFramebuffer(unsigned int id) 3469 { 3470 #if (defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_33) || defined(GRAPHICS_API_OPENGL_ES2)) && defined(RLGL_RENDER_TEXTURES_HINT) 3471 3472 // Query depth attachment to automatically delete texture/renderbuffer 3473 int depthType = 0, depthId = 0; 3486 glDeleteFramebuffers(1, &id); 3487 3488 TRACELOG(RL_LOG_INFO, "FBO: [ID %i] Unloaded framebuffer from VRAM (GPU)", id); 3489 #endif 3490 } 3491 3492 // Vertex data management 3493 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3494 // Load a new attributes buffer 3495 unsigned int rlLoadVertexBuffer(const void *buffer, int size, bool dynamic) 3496 { 3497 unsigned int id = 0; 4532 "{ \n" 4533 " vec4 texelColor = texture2D(texture0, fragTexCoord); \n" 4534 " gl_FragColor = texelColor*colDiffuse*fragColor; \n" 4535 "} \n"; 4536 #endif 4537 4538 // NOTE: Compiled
